articles.description: How were Celtic stunned in Kazakhstan by Kairat Almaty to miss Champions League bid?
articles.title: Champions League play-off: How did Celtic let dream slip from grasp?

articles.description: West Ham boss Graham Potter admits the Hammers are "in pain" but calls for unity after captain Jarrod Bowen has to apologise for trying to confront fans.
articles.title: West Ham United: Captain Jarrod Bowen apologises for fan row after Wolves defeat

articles.description: Keegan Bradley faces an unenviable task as he makes the final call on whether to include himself as a playing-captain in the US Ryder Cup team, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: Ryder Cup: US captain set to make 'controversial' wildcard picks to face Europe

articles.description: Britain's Jacob Fearnley secures the first US Open main-draw win of his career after coming through a testing first-round match.
articles.title: US Open 2025: Jacob Fearnley overcomes nerves to beat Roberto Bautista Agut & set up Alexander Zverev clash

articles.description: After a dramatic draft slide and a summer in the spotlight, rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders now has the chance to prove his doubters wrong having survived the NFL’s cut-down day.
articles.title: Shedeur Sanders: What next for NFL’s most controversial draft pick?

articles.description: Venus Williams will compete in the women's doubles at the US Open after being awarded a wildcard with Canada's Leylah Fernandez.
articles.title: US Open 2025: Venus Williams awarded women's doubles wildcard with Leylah Fernandez

articles.description: Sixteen-year-old sensation Rio Ngumoha is the talk of English football after his last-minute winner for Liverpool, but why did he leave Chelsea?
articles.title: Rio Ngumoha: How Liverpool poached wonderkid from Chelsea

articles.description: World number one Jannik Sinner drops only four games in a dominant straight-set win over Vit Kopriva in the US Open first round.
articles.title: US Open 2025 results: Jannik Sinner makes dominant start to title defence

articles.description: Jorgen Strand Larsen piles the misery on West Ham manager Graham Potter as Wolves come from behind to win their second-round Carabao Cup tie.
articles.title: Wolves 3-2 West Ham: Jorgen Strand Larsen scores twice to beat West Ham

articles.description: Thousands of Sheffield Wednesday fans stay away from Hillsborough for Tuesday's Carabao Cup second-round tie with Leeds United as protests against the club's ownership continue.
articles.title: Sheffield Wednesday fans boycott EFL Cup match against Leeds in ownership protest
